description.en:
Under Tajik law, all legal entities — including NGOs — are required to register with the national tax authority (Tax Committee under the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan). 

Once the entity is registered with the tax authority:

- the tax authority issues the Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) to the organization
- this number is assigned once and cannot be changed or reused, even if the entity is later dissolved
- the entity typically receives a certificate confirming the assignment of the TIN from the tax authority.

The TIN is used for all official tax reporting, financial transactions, and interactions with tax authorities in Tajikistan.

TINs consist of 9 digits. The specific structure includes:​ 

- First Part: Indicates the entity type or individual categorization.​ 
- Middle Section: A unique identifier related to individual or business registration numbers.​ 
- Last Section: Digits used for validation purposes. [1]

[1] https://taxdo.com/resources/global-tax-id-validation-guide/tajikistan
